name: Vegan Crab Cakes
description: If you used to like fish and crab cakes, you will love these vegan crab cakes with chickpeas and artichokes. They're super delicious, packed with flavor, and very easy to make.
recipeIngredient: 2 cans artichoke hearts in brine, drained and roughly chopped
2 teaspoons fish seasoning ((for example Old Bay) )

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, heat some oil and sauté the chopped onion for 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook for another minute. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, heat some oil and sauté the chopped onion for 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook for another minute. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the chickpeas in a large bowl with a fork. Leave them partially intact for more texture. Add the remaining ingredients (including the cooked onion and the garlic) and season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Mash the chickpeas in a large bowl with a fork. Leave them partially intact for more texture. Add the remaining ingredients (including the cooked onion and the garlic) and season with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large pan and cook them on each side on medium heat for about 2-3 minutes or until they're lightly browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some oil in a large pan and cook them on each side on medium heat for about 2-3 minutes or until they're lightly browned.

recipeInstructions.text: I served them on a bed of green salad with vegan remoulade and lemon slices. For the remoulade I whisked together vegan mayonnaise with chopped dill, fresh lemon juice and seasoned it with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: I served them on a bed of green salad with vegan remoulade and lemon slices. For the remoulade I whisked together vegan mayonnaise with chopped dill, fresh lemon juice and seasoned it with salt and pepper.

keywords: vegan crab cakes, vegetarian crab cakes
